trans-unit.source: Get Started with Azure Mobile Engagement for Cordova/Phonegap
trans-unit.target: Get Started with Azure Mobile Engagement for Cordova/Phonegap

trans-unit.source: Learn how to use Azure Mobile Engagement with Analytics and Push Notifications for Cordova/Phonegap apps.
trans-unit.target: Learn how to use Azure Mobile Engagement with Analytics and Push Notifications for Cordova/Phonegap apps.

trans-unit.source: This topic shows you how to use Azure Mobile Engagement to understand your app usage and send push notifications to segmented users for a mobile application developed with Cordova.
trans-unit.target: This topic shows you how to use Azure Mobile Engagement to understand your app usage and send push notifications to segmented users for a mobile application developed with Cordova.

trans-unit.source: In this tutorial, we will create a blank Cordova app using Mac and then integrate Mobile Engagement SDK.
trans-unit.target: In this tutorial, we will create a blank Cordova app using Mac and then integrate Mobile Engagement SDK.

trans-unit.source: It collects basic analytics data and receives push notifications using Apple Push Notification System (APNS) for iOS and Google Cloud Messaging (GCM) for Android.
trans-unit.target: It collects basic analytics data and receives push notifications using Apple Push Notification System (APNS) for iOS and Google Cloud Messaging (GCM) for Android.

trans-unit.source: We will deploy this to an iOS or Android device for testing.
trans-unit.target: We will deploy this to an iOS or Android device for testing.

trans-unit.source: To complete this tutorial, you must have an active Azure account.
trans-unit.target: To complete this tutorial, you must have an active Azure account.

trans-unit.source: If you don't have an account, you can create a free trial account in just a couple of minutes.
trans-unit.target: If you don't have an account, you can create a free trial account in just a couple of minutes.

trans-unit.source: For details, see Azure Free Trial.
trans-unit.target: For details, see Azure Free Trial.

trans-unit.source: This tutorial requires the following:
trans-unit.target: This tutorial requires the following:

trans-unit.source: XCode, which you can install from Mac App Store (for deploying to iOS)
trans-unit.target: XCode, which you can install from Mac App Store (for deploying to iOS)

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Android SDK & Emulator</linkText><title></title> (for deploying to Android)
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Android SDK & Emulator</linkText><title></title> (for deploying to Android)

trans-unit.source: Push notification certificate (.p12) that you can obtain from Apple Dev Center for APNS
trans-unit.target: Push notification certificate (.p12) that you can obtain from Apple Dev Center for APNS

trans-unit.source: GCM Project number that you can obtain from your Google Developer Console for GCM
trans-unit.target: GCM Project number that you can obtain from your Google Developer Console for GCM

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Mobile Engagement Cordova Plugin</linkText><title></title>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Mobile Engagement Cordova Plugin</linkText><title></title>

trans-unit.source: You can find the source code and the ReadMe for the Cordova plugin on <linkText>Github</linkText><title></title>
trans-unit.target: You can find the source code and the ReadMe for the Cordova plugin on <linkText>Github</linkText><title></title>

trans-unit.source: Log on to the Azure Management Portal, and then click +NEW at the bottom of the screen.
trans-unit.target: Log on to the Azure Management Portal, and then click +NEW at the bottom of the screen.

trans-unit.source: Click on App Services, then Mobile Engagement, and then Create.
trans-unit.target: Click on App Services, then Mobile Engagement, and then Create.

trans-unit.source: In the popup that appears, enter the following information:
trans-unit.target: In the popup that appears, enter the following information:

trans-unit.source: Application Name: Name of your application.
trans-unit.target: Application Name: Name of your application.

trans-unit.source: Platform: Target platform for the app (Choose iOS or Android depending on where you are deploying your Cordova App)
trans-unit.target: Platform: Target platform for the app (Choose iOS or Android depending on where you are deploying your Cordova App)

trans-unit.source: Application Resource Name: Name by which this application will be accessible via APIs and URLs.
trans-unit.target: Application Resource Name: Name by which this application will be accessible via APIs and URLs.

trans-unit.source: Location: Data center where this app and app collection will be hosted.
trans-unit.target: Location: Data center where this app and app collection will be hosted.

trans-unit.source: Collection: Select a previously created Collection or select 'New Collection'.
trans-unit.target: Collection: Select a previously created Collection or select 'New Collection'.

trans-unit.source: Collection Name: Represents your group of applications.
trans-unit.target: Collection Name: Represents your group of applications.

trans-unit.source: This will also ensure all your apps are in a group that will allow aggregated calculations of metrics.
trans-unit.target: This will also ensure all your apps are in a group that will allow aggregated calculations of metrics.

trans-unit.source: You should use your company name or department here if applicable.
trans-unit.target: You should use your company name or department here if applicable.

trans-unit.source: Select the app you just created in the Applications tab.
trans-unit.target: Select the app you just created in the Applications tab.

trans-unit.source: Click on Connection Info in order to display the connection settings to put into your SDK integration in your mobile app.
trans-unit.target: Click on Connection Info in order to display the connection settings to put into your SDK integration in your mobile app.

trans-unit.source: Copy the Connection String - this is what you will need to identify this app in your Application code and connect with Mobile Engagement from your Phone App.
trans-unit.target: Copy the Connection String - this is what you will need to identify this app in your Application code and connect with Mobile Engagement from your Phone App.

trans-unit.source: This tutorial presents a "basic integration" which is the minimal set required to collect data and send a push notification.
trans-unit.target: This tutorial presents a "basic integration" which is the minimal set required to collect data and send a push notification.

trans-unit.source: We will create a basic app with Cordova to demonstrate the integration:
trans-unit.target: We will create a basic app with Cordova to demonstrate the integration:

trans-unit.source: Launch Terminal window on your Mac machine and type the following which will create a new Cordova project from the default template:
trans-unit.target: Launch Terminal window on your Mac machine and type the following which will create a new Cordova project from the default template:

trans-unit.source: Make sure that the publishing profile you eventually use to deploy your iOS app is using 'com.mycompany.myapp' as the App ID.
trans-unit.target: Make sure that the publishing profile you eventually use to deploy your iOS app is using 'com.mycompany.myapp' as the App ID.

trans-unit.source: Execute the following to configure your project for iOS and run it in the iOS Simulator:
trans-unit.target: Execute the following to configure your project for iOS and run it in the iOS Simulator:

trans-unit.source: Execute the following to configure your project for Android and run it in the Android emulator:
trans-unit.target: Execute the following to configure your project for Android and run it in the Android emulator:

trans-unit.source: Add the Cordova Console plugin.
trans-unit.target: Add the Cordova Console plugin.

trans-unit.source: Install the Azure Mobile Engagement Cordova plugin while providing the variable values to configure the plugin:
trans-unit.target: Install the Azure Mobile Engagement Cordova plugin while providing the variable values to configure the plugin:

trans-unit.source: For example:
trans-unit.target: For example:

trans-unit.source: The AppId, SDKKey and Collection can be retrieved from the connection string Endpoint={YourAppCollection.Domain};SdkKey={YourSDKKey};AppId={YourAppId}
trans-unit.target: The AppId, SDKKey and Collection can be retrieved from the connection string Endpoint={YourAppCollection.Domain};SdkKey={YourSDKKey};AppId={YourAppId}

trans-unit.source: In the Cordova project - edit www/js/index.js to add the call to Mobile Engagement to declare a new activity once the deviceReady event is received.
trans-unit.target: In the Cordova project - edit www/js/index.js to add the call to Mobile Engagement to declare a new activity once the deviceReady event is received.

trans-unit.source: Run the application:
trans-unit.target: Run the application:

trans-unit.source: For iOS
trans-unit.target: For iOS

trans-unit.source: In Terminal window launch your app in a new Simulator instance by executing the following:
trans-unit.target: In Terminal window launch your app in a new Simulator instance by executing the following:

trans-unit.source: For Android
trans-unit.target: For Android

trans-unit.source: In Terminal window launch your app in a new emulator instance by executing the following:
trans-unit.target: In Terminal window launch your app in a new emulator instance by executing the following:

trans-unit.source: You can see the following in the console logs:
trans-unit.target: You can see the following in the console logs:

trans-unit.source: This section shows you how to make sure your app connects to the Mobile Engagement backend by using Mobile Engagement's realtime monitoring feature.
trans-unit.target: This section shows you how to make sure your app connects to the Mobile Engagement backend by using Mobile Engagement's realtime monitoring feature.

trans-unit.source: Navigate to your Mobile Engagement portal
trans-unit.target: Navigate to your Mobile Engagement portal

trans-unit.source: From your Azure portal, ensure you're in the app we're using for this project and then click on the Engage button at the bottom:
trans-unit.target: From your Azure portal, ensure you're in the app we're using for this project and then click on the Engage button at the bottom:

trans-unit.source: You will land in the settings page in your Engagement Portal for your app.
trans-unit.target: You will land in the settings page in your Engagement Portal for your app.

trans-unit.source: From there click on the Monitor tab:
trans-unit.target: From there click on the Monitor tab:

trans-unit.source: If your app running in the Emulator is configured correctly then you will see a session logged in realtime while your app is running:
trans-unit.target: If your app running in the Emulator is configured correctly then you will see a session logged in realtime while your app is running:

trans-unit.source: Mobile Engagement allows you to interact with your users using Push Notifications and in-app messaging in the context of campaigns.
trans-unit.target: Mobile Engagement allows you to interact with your users using Push Notifications and in-app messaging in the context of campaigns.

trans-unit.source: This module is called REACH in the Mobile Engagement portal.
trans-unit.target: This module is called REACH in the Mobile Engagement portal.

trans-unit.source: The following sections will setup your app to receive them.
trans-unit.target: The following sections will setup your app to receive them.

trans-unit.source: To allow Mobile Engagement to send Push Notifications on your behalf, you need to grant it access to your Apple iOS certificate or GCM Server API Key.
trans-unit.target: To allow Mobile Engagement to send Push Notifications on your behalf, you need to grant it access to your Apple iOS certificate or GCM Server API Key.

trans-unit.source: Navigate to your Mobile Engagement portal.
trans-unit.target: Navigate to your Mobile Engagement portal.

trans-unit.source: Ensure you're in the app we're using for this project and then click on the Engage button at the bottom:
trans-unit.target: Ensure you're in the app we're using for this project and then click on the Engage button at the bottom:

trans-unit.source: You will land in the settings page in your Engagement Portal.
trans-unit.target: You will land in the settings page in your Engagement Portal.

trans-unit.source: From there click on the Native Push section:
trans-unit.target: From there click on the Native Push section:

trans-unit.source: Configure iOS Certificate/GCM Server API Key
trans-unit.target: Configure iOS Certificate/GCM Server API Key

trans-unit.source: [iOS]
trans-unit.target: [iOS]

trans-unit.source: a.
trans-unit.target: a.

trans-unit.source: Select your .p12, upload it and type your password:
trans-unit.target: Select your .p12, upload it and type your password:

trans-unit.source: [Android]
trans-unit.target: [Android]

trans-unit.source: a.
trans-unit.target: a.

trans-unit.source: Click the edit icon in front of API Key in the GCM Settings section as shown below:
trans-unit.target: Click the edit icon in front of API Key in the GCM Settings section as shown below:

trans-unit.source: b.
trans-unit.target: b.

trans-unit.source: In the popup, paste the GCM Server Key then click Ok.
trans-unit.target: In the popup, paste the GCM Server Key then click Ok.

trans-unit.source: Edit www/js/index.js to add the call to Mobile Engagement to request push notifications and declare a handler:
trans-unit.target: Edit www/js/index.js to add the call to Mobile Engagement to request push notifications and declare a handler:

trans-unit.source: [iOS]
trans-unit.target: [iOS]

trans-unit.source: We will use XCode to build and deploy the app on the device to test push notifications since iOS only allows push notifications to an actual device.
trans-unit.target: We will use XCode to build and deploy the app on the device to test push notifications since iOS only allows push notifications to an actual device.

trans-unit.source: Go to the location where your Cordova project is created and navigate to ...\platforms\ios location.
trans-unit.target: Go to the location where your Cordova project is created and navigate to ...\platforms\ios location.

trans-unit.source: Open up the native .xcodeproj file in XCode.
trans-unit.target: Open up the native .xcodeproj file in XCode.

trans-unit.source: Build and deploy the Cordova app to the iOS device using the account which has the provisioning profile containing the certificate you just uploaded to the Mobile Engagement portal and the App Id which matches the one you provided while creating the Cordova app.
trans-unit.target: Build and deploy the Cordova app to the iOS device using the account which has the provisioning profile containing the certificate you just uploaded to the Mobile Engagement portal and the App Id which matches the one you provided while creating the Cordova app.

trans-unit.source: You can check out the Bundle identifier in your Resources\*-info.plist file in XCode to match it up.
trans-unit.target: You can check out the Bundle identifier in your Resources\*-info.plist file in XCode to match it up.

trans-unit.source: You will see the standard iOS popup on your device saying that the app requests permission to send notifications.
trans-unit.target: You will see the standard iOS popup on your device saying that the app requests permission to send notifications.

trans-unit.source: Grant the permission.
trans-unit.target: Grant the permission.

trans-unit.source: [Android]
trans-unit.target: [Android]

trans-unit.source: You can simply use the emulator to run the Android app as GCM notifications are supported on the Android emulator.
trans-unit.target: You can simply use the emulator to run the Android app as GCM notifications are supported on the Android emulator.

trans-unit.source: We will now create a simple Push Notification campaign that will send a push to your app running on the device:
trans-unit.target: We will now create a simple Push Notification campaign that will send a push to your app running on the device:

trans-unit.source: Navigate to the Reach tab in your Mobile Engagement portal
trans-unit.target: Navigate to the Reach tab in your Mobile Engagement portal

trans-unit.source: Click New Announcement to create your push campaign
trans-unit.target: Click New Announcement to create your push campaign

trans-unit.source: Provide inputs to create your campaign:
trans-unit.target: Provide inputs to create your campaign:

trans-unit.source: Provide a name for your campaign.
trans-unit.target: Provide a name for your campaign.

trans-unit.source: [Android] Select the Delivery Type as System notification - Simple
trans-unit.target: [Android] Select the Delivery Type as System notification - Simple

trans-unit.source: Select the Delivery time as
trans-unit.target: Select the Delivery time as

trans-unit.source: For iOS : "Out of app only"
trans-unit.target: For iOS : "Out of app only"

trans-unit.source: For Android : "Any Time"
trans-unit.target: For Android : "Any Time"

trans-unit.source: This is the simple push notification type that features some text.
trans-unit.target: This is the simple push notification type that features some text.

trans-unit.source: In the notification text, type first the Title which will be the first line in the push
trans-unit.target: In the notification text, type first the Title which will be the first line in the push

trans-unit.source: Then type your message which will be the second line
trans-unit.target: Then type your message which will be the second line

trans-unit.source: Scroll down, and in the content section select Notification only
trans-unit.target: Scroll down, and in the content section select Notification only

trans-unit.source: [Optional] You can also provide an Action URL.
trans-unit.target: [Optional] You can also provide an Action URL.

trans-unit.source: Make sure that it uses a URL scheme provided while configuring the plugin's AZME REDIRECT URL variable e.g. myapp://test.
trans-unit.target: Make sure that it uses a URL scheme provided while configuring the plugin's AZME REDIRECT URL variable e.g. myapp://test.

trans-unit.source: You're done setting the most basic campaign possible, now scroll down again and Create your campaign to save it.
trans-unit.target: You're done setting the most basic campaign possible, now scroll down again and Create your campaign to save it.

trans-unit.source: Finally Activate your campaign
trans-unit.target: Finally Activate your campaign

trans-unit.source: You should now see a push notification on your device or emulator as part of this campaign.
trans-unit.target: You should now see a push notification on your device or emulator as part of this campaign.
